channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: If Everyone Had Voted, Kamala Harris Still Would Have Lost
item.description: New data, based on authoritative voter records, suggests that Donald Trump would have done even better in 2024 with higher turnout.

item.title: Meet Shubhanshu Shukla, Tibor Kapu, and Slawosz Uznanski-Wisniewski, the first astronauts from India, Hungary, and Poland to visit the International Space Station
item.description: Axiom Space, based in Houston, arranged the chartered flight, which was commanded by America’s most experienced astronaut, Peggy Whitson.

item.title: RFK Jr. and his new vaccine committee are obsessing over thimerosal, a preservative antivaxxers have falsely tied to autism despite zero evidence of causation
item.description: Some public health experts contend the thimerosal discussion will unnecessarily raise doubt in vaccines.

item.title: The Alaska Town at the Center of Trump’s $44 Billion LNG Push
item.description: Nikiski in southern Alaska is waiting to see if backing from President Trump and a new developer will advance a decades-old initiative to export natur...

item.title: Supreme Court Rules Planned Parenthood Cannot Sue Over S. Carolina Defunding Effort
item.description: The question for the justices was whether Medicaid beneficiaries may sue to receive services under a law that lets them choose any qualified provider.

item.title: Fortune 500 companies that have active contracts with ICE
item.description: From AT&T to FedEx, these are the organizations contracting with the Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

item.title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Khamenei Makes First Public Comments in Almost a Week
item.description: Supreme leader strikes defiant tone in a video statement, after not being heard of or seen publicly in days.

item.title: Pennsylvania House passes bill mandating cursive education in schools
item.description: An analog throwback in a digital world.

item.title: Rewarding carbon-conscious consumers isn’t radical—it’s the future of banking
item.description: Smart banks will earn Gen Z loyalty by incorporating ESG signals into how customers are scored, segmented, and rewarded.

item.title: Germany Wants Recruits. But ‘No One Wants Their Children in the Army.’
item.description: Given the country’s past, cultural resistance to becoming a soldier is high. Can leaders change minds to meet a changing world?

item.title: With Bezos Wedding, Venice Braces for Love in the Time of Tech Billionaires
item.description: The celebration of Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sánchez has divided a city that centuries ago set the standard for opulence.

item.title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Khamenei Makes First Public Comments in Almost a Week
item.description: Supreme leader strikes defiant tone in a video statement, after not being heard of or seen publicly in days.

item.title: Iran’s Leader Says U.S. President is ‘Exaggerating’ Success of Strikes
item.description: In his first remarks since the cease-fire agreement, Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, declared victory over the U.S. and Israel, and acc...

item.title: Republicans Propose a New Way to Scrap Fuel Economy Rules: No Fines
item.description: For 50 years, automakers have had to increase the fuel efficiency of their vehicles or pay fines. The Republican megabill would set those penalties to...

item.title: Germany Wants Recruits. But ‘No One Wants Their Children in the Army.’
item.description: Given the country’s past, cultural resistance to becoming a soldier is high. Can leaders change minds to meet a changing world?
